pull.title: Tests: Fix deserialization of reject messages

events.message:
Tests: Fix deserialization of reject messages

Assume that reject messages for blocks or transactions due to reason
REJECT_MALFORMED will not include the hash of the block or tx being rejected.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -994,14 +995,16 @@ def deserialize(self, f):
         self.message = deser_string(f)
         self.code = struct.unpack("<B", f.read(1))[0]
         self.reason = deser_string(f)
-        if (self.message == "block" or self.message == "tx"):
+        if (self.code != self.REJECT_MALFORMED and
+                (self.message == "block" or self.message == "tx")):
             self.data = deser_uint256(f)
 
     def serialize(self):
         r = ser_string(self.message)
         r += struct.pack("<B", self.code)
         r += ser_string(self.reason)
-        if (self.message == "block" or self.message == "tx"):
+        if (self.code != self.REJECT_MALFORMED and
+                (self.message == "block" or self.message == "tx")):
comments.body:
Jup, please the `b""` here.

Currently they are included in #7814 but it also makes sense to add them here.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -994,14 +995,16 @@ def deserialize(self, f):
         self.message = deser_string(f)
         self.code = struct.unpack("<B", f.read(1))[0]
         self.reason = deser_string(f)
-        if (self.message == "block" or self.message == "tx"):
+        if (self.code != self.REJECT_MALFORMED and
+                (self.message == "block" or self.message == "tx")):
             self.data = deser_uint256(f)
 
     def serialize(self):
         r = ser_string(self.message)
         r += struct.pack("<B", self.code)
         r += ser_string(self.reason)
-        if (self.message == "block" or self.message == "tx"):
+        if (self.code != self.REJECT_MALFORMED and
+                (self.message == "block" or self.message == "tx")):
comments.body: right: rationale is that message ids are byte sequences directly from the packet, not strings for user consumption, so they should be `bytes` not `str`

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -994,14 +995,16 @@ def deserialize(self, f):
         self.message = deser_string(f)
         self.code = struct.unpack("<B", f.read(1))[0]
         self.reason = deser_string(f)
-        if (self.message == "block" or self.message == "tx"):
+        if (self.code != self.REJECT_MALFORMED and
+                (self.message == "block" or self.message == "tx")):
             self.data = deser_uint256(f)
 
     def serialize(self):
         r = ser_string(self.message)
         r += struct.pack("<B", self.code)
         r += ser_string(self.reason)
-        if (self.message == "block" or self.message == "tx"):
+        if (self.code != self.REJECT_MALFORMED and
+                (self.message == "block" or self.message == "tx")):
comments.body:
If you feel strongly about adding them in the other places as well:
- `msg_reject`: `self.reason = b""`

and (optionally)

``` py
def ser_uint256(u):
def ser_string_vector(l):
CAlert().serialize(self):
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -994,14 +995,16 @@ def deserialize(self, f):
         self.message = deser_string(f)
         self.code = struct.unpack("<B", f.read(1))[0]
         self.reason = deser_string(f)
-        if (self.message == "block" or self.message == "tx"):
+        if (self.code != self.REJECT_MALFORMED and
+                (self.message == "block" or self.message == "tx")):
             self.data = deser_uint256(f)
 
     def serialize(self):
         r = ser_string(self.message)
         r += struct.pack("<B", self.code)
         r += ser_string(self.reason)
-        if (self.message == "block" or self.message == "tx"):
+        if (self.code != self.REJECT_MALFORMED and
+                (self.message == "block" or self.message == "tx")):
comments.body: Well it is important to avoid unexpected results. b'123'=='123' evaluates to False in Python3.

comments.body: I have all of this included in my py3 branch, so it is not mandatory to fix all issues right now. (Otherwise I'd be creating pulls every other day to keep the whole py2 codebase "updated") E.g. we got new test in `fundrawtransaction.py` which are using the old `except JSONRPCException,e:` syntax but it is not worth to create a pull for those right now, imo.
